title: Ticket #3645: reconcile differences in config files between condor rpm versions
description:
The UW/OSG/Fedora versions of the condor RPM have different versions of the config files / system scripts (condor_config, sysconfig, and init.d).

Find out what the differences are and reconcile them into unified versions that cover the functionality of the three.
remarks:
2013-May-22 10:51:06 by tstclair:
IIRC - the uw package installs to non-native locations.

2013-Jun-12 16:58:34 by edquist:
See attached summary of config file differences.

Most of the differences are from the main condor_config, both variable definitions and comments... Need to decide what is "correct" or "best" in each case.

The UW and OSG rpms use completely different init.d scripts... Probably we'll use whatever falls out of the init.d script improvements Brian L is working on.

2013-Jun-19 17:39:47 by edquist:
In the FW packaging meeting today TJ mentioned that the config file in the UW rpm hasn't been revisited in quite some time... It'd be good to look over what's different in the OSG version, but it sounds like most likely the unified rpm will adopt the changes introduced there.

2013-Aug-19 07:04:32 by edquist:
I am attaching a handful of files here related to the condor_config changes I've made for the unified rpm. (All of this is based on 7.9.6 version; but as far as I can see no changes happen between that and the example condor_config.generic that comes with 8.0.0.) 

  1. condor_config.generic.examples-source
     - this is the example condor_config.generic from the source
  2. condor_config.installed-uw
     - this is the condor_config that ships with the uw rpm
  3. condor_config.installed-unif
     - this is the condor_config that ships with the unified rpm
  4. condor_config.generic-unif.patch
     - patch applied to the example generic config in the unified rpm
  5. config_batch_gahp_path.patch
     - patch applied if doing a proper build (no blahp external)
  6. condor_config.diff-uw-unif.patch
     - differences between the two rpm versions

Note that 4+5 != 6 since the uw rpm makes it's own changes to the example generic config. Not sure which ones will be most relevant for FW review, maybe 4/5, maybe just 6?
